channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Nick Reiner's attorney removes himself from case
item.description: Defense attorney Alan Jackson said that circumstances beyond his and Reiner's control made it "impossible" to continue representation.
item.content:encoded:
Defense attorney Alan Jackson said that circumstances beyond his and Reiner's control made it "impossible" to continue representation.

(Image credit: Richard Shotwell/Invision/AP)
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman

item.title: Béla Fleck cancels Kennedy Center appearance, says it's become 'charged and political'
item.description: The 18-time Grammy Award winner is the latest musician to cancel an show at the Kennedy Center. Béla Fleck says he cannot currently perform there because it "has become charged and political."
item.content:encoded:
The 18-time Grammy Award winner is the latest musician to cancel an show at the Kennedy Center. Béla Fleck says he cannot currently perform there because it "has become charged and political."

(Image credit: Leon Bennett)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: Timothée Chalamet brings a lot to the table in 'Marty Supreme'
item.description: Chalamet stars as a scrappy shoe salesman who dreams of becoming the greatest table tennis player in the world — and is willing to steal, cheat, sweet-talk and hustle his way to the top.
item.content:encoded: Chalamet stars as a scrappy shoe salesman who dreams of becoming the greatest table tennis player in the world — and is willing to steal, cheat, sweet-talk and hustle his way to the top.
item.dc:creator: Justin Chang

item.title: 'American Reich' author details a national surge in bigotry and white supremacy
item.description: Journalist Eric Lichtblau says President Trump's incendiary rhetoric has stoked a "new age of hate." His book centers on a murder committed by a young neo-Nazi in Orange County, Calif.
item.content:encoded: Journalist Eric Lichtblau says President Trump's incendiary rhetoric has stoked a "new age of hate." His book centers on a murder committed by a young neo-Nazi in Orange County, Calif.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies

item.title: A 200-year-old book distributor is closing. Here's what that means for public libraries
item.description: Baker & Taylor is one of very few companies that handle book distribution for libraries — getting books from publishers into borrowers hands. But a few months ago, the company abruptly announced it was shutting down.
item.content:encoded: Baker & Taylor is one of very few companies that handle book distribution for libraries — getting books from publishers into borrowers hands. But a few months ago, the company abruptly announced it was shutting down.
item.dc:creator: Alina Edwards

item.title: Hungarian filmmaker Béla Tarr — known for bleak, existential movies — has died
item.description: Tarr's films were long, dark, and often abstract explorations of everyday life and politics.
item.content:encoded:
Tarr's films were long, dark, and often abstract explorations of everyday life and politics.

(Image credit: Andreas Rentz)
item.dc:creator: Alina Edwards

item.title: Put these 12 eye-opening books on your 2026 reading list
item.description: Want to learn something new in the new year? Check out these deep-dive books from 2025 — nonfiction that will lead you to fresh discoveries about big tech, true crime and the ground beneath our feet.
item.content:encoded: Want to learn something new in the new year? Check out these deep-dive books from 2025 — nonfiction that will lead you to fresh discoveries about big tech, true crime and the ground beneath our feet.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: How another hospital patient helped saved a man
item.description: In 2013, John was chatting with another patient in the hospital when his words abruptly slurred. That patient recognized something was wrong and called for help, and doctors were able to intervene.
item.content:encoded: In 2013, John was chatting with another patient in the hospital when his words abruptly slurred. That patient recognized something was wrong and called for help, and doctors were able to intervene.

item.title: 'Everything I knew burned down around me': A journalist looks back on LA's fires
item.description: Jacob Soboroff was raised in the Pacific Palisades and reported live from the area as it was devastated by fire in 2025. In Firestorm, Soboroff offers a minute-by-minute account of the catastrophe.
item.content:encoded:
Jacob Soboroff was raised in the Pacific Palisades and reported live from the area as it was devastated by fire in 2025. In Firestorm, Soboroff offers a minute-by-minute account of the catastrophe.

(Image credit: Josh Edelson)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Feeling cooped up? Get out of town with this delightful literary road trip
item.description: In The Rest of Our Lives, the narrator drops his daughter off to college — then keeps on driving, leaving his marriage behind. Ben Markovits' novel was shortlisted for the Booker Prize.
item.content:encoded: In The Rest of Our Lives, the narrator drops his daughter off to college — then keeps on driving, leaving his marriage behind. Ben Markovits' novel was shortlisted for the Booker Prize.
item.dc:creator: Maureen Corrigan
